attributes.comment:
It was my impression that the United States was trying to cut down on the amount
of illegal immigrants within the US. Illegal immigrants and legal immigrants are
having a hard enough time finding employment that pays enough to feed
themselves and/or their families. If these fees are increased (all but 1 fee
increasing at least 40%), how are the immigrants supposed to afford to become
legal? In addition, some of the forms are used in conjunction with adoption
overseas. Adoption already costs a small fortune ($10k - $50k). Raising the fees
66% does nothing to assist these children that need a chance to thrive, grow, and
eventually pay taxes. Most parents interested in and pursuing adoption are not
wealthy. They have to beg, plead, finance, and fundraise for this money already.
Why are we making it even more difficult to become an American Citizen when we
already have more illegals than the country can handle? This does not solve the
problem. It only increases it.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Mary C. Rice
